intro: Leucopogon tamminensis, commonly known as the Tammin heath, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of Western Australia. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and related species. The plant is characterized by its dense, low-growing shrub form with small, leathery leaves. It produces clusters of white or pale pink flowers during the spring and summer months. Leucopogon tamminensis is adapted to sandy soils and is often found in heathlands and coastal dunes.
